etymology.description: semantic: 心(心) (xīn, "heart") + phonetic: 圣(聖) (shèng, "sacred") = heart associated with sacred or unusual -> weird, strange
etymology.interpretation: The character 怪(怪) (guài, "weird") combines 心(心) (xīn, "heart") to represent emotions or feelings and 圣(聖) (shèng, "sacred") to convey a sense of the extraordinary or unusual. Together, they emphasize a feeling connected with strange or unusual occurrences.

examples.chinese: 他的笑容看起来很怪(他的笑容看起來很怪)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de xiàoróng kàn qǐlái hěn guài.

examples.chinese: 妈妈不怪我(媽媽不怪我)，因为我已经尽力了(因為我已經盡力了)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā bù guài wǒ, yīnwèi wǒ yǐjīng jìnlì le.
examples.english: Mom doesn't blame me because I have done my best.

examples.chinese: 傍晚时分(傍晚時分)，远处传来怪响(遠處傳來怪響)。
examples.pinyin: Bàngwǎn shífēn, yuǎnchù chuán lái guài xiǎng.
examples.english: At dusk, strange sounds came from afar.
